abstract.p: Median price of house in Westchester County, NY, has risen to $400,000 from $355,000 over past year (S)

block.p: A short supply of houses and a jump in the sales of high-priced homes has caused the median price of a house in Westchester County to rise to $400,000, from $355,000, in the past year, according to the latest quarterly figures from the Westchester-Putnam Multiple Listing Service. The prices might stymie first-time home buyers but should correct themselves as the decline in inventory eases, said P. Gilbert Mercurio, executive vice president of the Westchester County Board of Realtors. Mr. Mercurio said a vigorous market caused sales to outpace supply and drive up prices. Constance DeFilippis, co-owner of Gains Realty in White Plains, said, ''Where a $200,000 home used to be the starter home, it is now over $300,000.''

A short supply of houses and a jump in the sales of high-priced homes has caused the median price of a house in Westchester County to rise to $400,000, from $355,000, in the past year, according to the latest quarterly figures from the Westchester-Putnam Multiple Listing Service. The prices might stymie first-time home buyers but should correct themselves as the decline in inventory eases, said P. Gilbert Mercurio, executive vice president of the Westchester County Board of Realtors. Mr. Mercurio said a vigorous market caused sales to outpace supply and drive up prices. Constance DeFilippis, co-owner of Gains Realty in White Plains, said, ''Where a $200,000 home used to be the starter home, it is now over $300,000.''
